p: In agriculture, EOs have been successfully tested as a natural disease control technique for managing the growth of harmful phytopathogens ( LÃ³pez et al., 2017). It is believed that EOs is safe product. So that, high demand for them in agriculture. The most special and important area for applying EOs or their constituents is growth inhibition and reduction of phytopathogens. For example, the genus Xanthomonas (Gram-negative), causes disease in many plants including cereals. This fact makes Xanthomonas is one of the major problems in farming systems. Control of such plant diseases is extremely difficult and costly, as they can easily be spread from contaminated plants via rainwater, wind, birds, and insects ( Sundin et al., 2016). Although few publications had documented on the activities of EOs against Xanthomonas, but latest report revealed that EOs applications was effective in inhibiting the growth of Xanthomonas ( Sahu et al., 2018).
